definition: to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend

sentences.english: Her husband, who sells used car parts, has seen his commissions drop.
sentences.chinese: 她的丈夫经销二手次车配件，他的薪酬也下降了。
夜晚的污染程度则会下降。

sentences.english: The proof is in the reduced-fat pudding.
sentences.chinese: 证据就是脂肪含量下降的布丁。

sentences.english: Across the industry, occupancy rates have dropped about 10 percent Carew said.
sentences.chinese: 整个行业，住房率已下降10%左右，卡鲁说。

sentences.english: It will rain, for the barometer is falling.
sentences.chinese: 天将会下雨，因为气压表正在下降。

sentences.english: The drop in temperature frosted the tomato plants.
sentences.chinese: 气温下降冻坏了番茄苗。

sentences.english: Ad pages have declined even more at Fortune and BusinessWeek.
sentences.chinese: 《财富》和《商业周刊》的广告页数下降更多。

sentences.english: To reverse the " decline " in sales of Sable, and Mercury are also great to cut costs.
sentences.chinese: 扭转销售下降的紫貂，水星也主要成本削减。

sentences.english: Do vomiting and the eyesight that can diarrhoea cause abrupt sex drop?
sentences.chinese: 呕吐和腹泻会引起突然性的视力下降吗？

sentences.english: She has little vision, decreased hearing and cannot speak.
sentences.chinese: 她的视力不佳，听力下降，也不能说话。

sentences.english: Both drug-eluting stents were associated with a marked reduction in target-lesion revascularization.
sentences.chinese: 两种药物涂层组靶血管病变的发生率均显著下降。

sentences.english: And the numbers are rising at the same time crime rates are dropping.
sentences.chinese: 被盘查的人数正在上升，同时犯罪率在下降。

sentences.english: China's iron-ore import volumes actually fell in 2010.
sentences.chinese: 中国2010年铁矿石进口量反而下降。

sentences.english: He says this will help the industry, but not enough.
sentences.chinese: 他说，油价下降对航空业有好处，但这并不够。

sentences.english: These small businesses have benefited greatly from the fall in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 小企业应利率下降而获得了很年夜的好处。

definition: to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to be on the low side/to be inadequate (e.g. of a salary)
